title: Awesome List Updates on Mar 27, 2023

items.title: Awesome Pinned Gists
items.content_text:
### External Services

*   [playstation-box (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/Swilder-M/playstation-box) - Update a pinned gist to contain your PlayStation playtime leaderboard.
items.content_html:
External Services

items.title: Awesome Orgs
items.content_text:
### Companies

*   [Grafana Labs](https://github.com/grafana) - Grafana Labs is behind leading open source projects Grafana and Loki and the creator of the first open & composable observability platform.

### Web

*   [Poppinss](https://github.com/poppinss) - Small, focused modules for Node.js.
*   [Oven](https://github.com/oven-sh) - The company behind Bun, the swift JavaScript runtime, bundler, transpiler, and package manager.
*   [Cypress.io](https://github.com/cypress-io) - Fast, easy, and reliable testing for anything that runs in a browser.
*   [Fiber](https://github.com/gofiber) - Fiber is an Express-inspired web framework written in Go with üíñ.

### Database

*   [SurrealDB](https://github.com/surrealdb) - A scalable, distributed, collaborative, document-graph database for the real-time web.

### Other

*   [Nrwl](https://github.com/nrwl) - We are a team of engineers building open-source software: Nx and Nx Cloud.
items.content_html:
Companies

  • Grafana Labs - Grafana Labs is behind leading open source projects Grafana and Loki and the creator of the first open & composable observability platform.

Web

  • Poppinss - Small, focused modules for Node.js.
  • Oven - The company behind Bun, the swift JavaScript runtime, bundler, transpiler, and package manager.
  • Cypress.io - Fast, easy, and reliable testing for anything that runs in a browser.
  • Fiber - Fiber is an Express-inspired web framework written in Go with üíñ.

Database

  • SurrealDB - A scalable, distributed, collaborative, document-graph database for the real-time web.

Other

  • Nrwl - We are a team of engineers building open-source software: Nx and Nx Cloud.

items.title: Awesome Selfhosted

### Software / Analytics

items.title: Android Security Awesome
items.content_text:
### Tools / Online Analyzers

*   [Appknox](https://www.appknox.com/) - not free
*   [Virustotal](https://www.virustotal.com/) - max 128MB
*   [Fraunhofer App-ray](http://app-ray.co/) - not free
*   [NowSecure Lab Automated](https://www.nowsecure.com/blog/2016/09/19/announcing-nowsecure-lab-automated/) - Enterprise tool for mobile app security testing both Android and iOS mobile apps. Lab Automated features dynamic and static analysis on real devices in the cloud to return results in minutes. Not free
*   [AppSweep by Guardsquare](https://appsweep.guardsquare.com/) - Free, fast Android application security testing for developers
*   ~~[BitBaan](https://malab.bitbaan.com/)~~
*   ~~[AVC UnDroid](http://undroid.av-comparatives.info/)~~
*   ~~[AppCritique](https://appcritique.boozallen.com) - Upload your Android APKs and receive comprehensive free security assessments~~
*   ~~[NVISO ApkScan](https://apkscan.nviso.be/) - sunsetting on Oct 31, 2019~~
*   ~~[Mobile Malware Sandbox](http://www.mobilemalware.com.br/analysis/index_en.php)~~
*   ~~[IBM Security AppScan Mobile Analyzer](https://appscan.bluemix.net/mobileAnalyzer) - not free~~
*   ~~[Visual Threat](https://www.visualthreat.com/) - no longer an Android app analyzer~~
*   ~~[Tracedroid](http://tracedroid.few.vu.nl/)~~
*   ~~[habo](https://habo.qq.com/) - 10/day~~
*   ~~[CopperDroid](http://copperdroid.isg.rhul.ac.uk/copperdroid/)~~
*   ~~[SandDroid](http://sanddroid.xjtu.edu.cn/)~~
*   ~~[Stowaway](http://www.android-permissions.org/)~~
*   ~~[Anubis](http://anubis.iseclab.org/)~~
*   ~~[Mobile app insight](http://www.mobile-app-insight.org)~~
*   ~~[Mobile-Sandbox](http://mobile-sandbox.com)~~
*   ~~[Ijiami](http://safe.ijiami.cn/)~~
*   ~~[Comdroid](http://www.comdroid.org/)~~
*   ~~[Android Sandbox](http://www.androidsandbox.net/)~~
*   ~~[Foresafe](http://www.foresafe.com/scan)~~
*   ~~[Dexter](https://dexter.dexlabs.org/)~~
*   ~~[MobiSec Eacus](http://www.mobiseclab.org/eacus.jsp)~~
*   ~~[Fireeye](https://fireeye.ijinshan.com/)- max 60MB 15/day~~

### Tools / Static Analysis Tools

*   [ApkAnalyser (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/sonyxperiadev/ApkAnalyser)
*   [APKInspector (‚≠ê844)](https://github.com/honeynet/apkinspector/)
*   [DroidLegacy](https://bitbucket.org/srl/droidlegacy)
*   [FlowDroid](https://blogs.uni-paderborn.de/sse/tools/flowdroid/)
*   [Android Decompiler](https://www.pnfsoftware.com/) ‚Äì not free
*   [Amandroid](http://amandroid.sireum.org/)
*   [SmaliSCA (‚≠ê323)](https://github.com/dorneanu/smalisca) - Smali Static Code Analysis
*   [Madrolyzer (‚≠ê109)](https://github.com/maldroid/maldrolyzer) - extracts actionable data like C\&C, phone number etc.
*   [ConDroid (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/JulianSchuette/ConDroid) - Performs a combination of symbolic + concrete execution of the app
*   [DroidRA (‚≠ê51)](https://github.com/serval-snt-uni-lu/DroidRA)
*   [Quark-Engine (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/quark-engine/quark-engine) - An Obfuscation-Neglect Android Malware Scoring System
*   [One Step Decompiler (‚≠ê277)](https://github.com/b-mueller/apkx) - Android APK Decompilation for the Lazy
*   [APKLeaks (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/dwisiswant0/apkleaks) - Scanning APK file for URIs, endpoints & secrets.
*   [Mobile Audit (‚≠ê217)](https://github.com/mpast/mobileAudit) - Web application for performing Static Analysis and detecting malware in Android APKs.
*   ~~[Several tools from PSU](http://siis.cse.psu.edu/tools.html)~~

### Tools / App Vulnerability Scanners

*   [AndroBugs (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/AndroBugs/AndroBugs_Framework)
*   [Nogotofail (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/google/nogotofail)
*   ~~[Devknox](https://devknox.io/) - IDE plugin to build secure Android apps. Not maintained anymore.~~

### Tools / Dynamic Analysis Tools

*   [Androl4b (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/sh4hin/Androl4b)- A Virtual Machine For Assessing Android applications, Reverse Engineering and Malware Analysis
*   [House (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/nccgroup/house)- House: A runtime mobile application analysis toolkit with a Web GUI, powered by Frida, written in Python.
*   [Droidbox (‚≠ê782)](https://github.com/pjlantz/droidbox)
*   [Drozer (‚≠ê4.2k)](https://github.com/mwrlabs/drozer)
*   [Android Hooker (‚≠ê412)](https://github.com/AndroidHooker/hooker) - Dynamic Java code instrumentation (requires the Substrate Framework)
*   [ProbeDroid (‚≠ê200)](https://github.com/ZSShen/ProbeDroid) - Dynamic Java code instrumentation
*   [DECAF (‚≠ê822)](https://github.com/sycurelab/DECAF) - Dynamic Executable Code Analysis Framework based on QEMU (DroidScope is now an extension to DECAF)
*   [CuckooDroid (‚≠ê590)](https://github.com/idanr1986/cuckoo-droid) - Android extension for Cuckoo sandbox
*   [Mem (‚≠ê68)](https://github.com/MobileForensicsResearch/mem) - Memory analysis of Android (root required)
*   [Crowdroid](http://www.ida.liu.se/labs/rtslab/publications/2011/spsm11-burguera.pdf) ‚Äì unable to find the actual tool
*   [Android Security Evaluation Framework](https://code.google.com/p/asef/) - not under active development anymore
*   [Android Linux Kernel modules (‚≠ê213)](https://github.com/strazzere/android-lkms)
*   [StaDynA (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/zyrikby/StaDynA) - a system supporting security app analysis in the presence of dynamic code update features (dynamic class loading and reflection). This tool combines static and dynamic analysis of Android applications in order to reveal the hidden/updated behavior and extend static analysis results with this information.
*   [DroidAnalytics (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/zhengmin1989/DroidAnalytics) - incomplete
*   [Vezir Project (‚≠ê108)](https://github.com/oguzhantopgul/Vezir-Project) - Virtual Machine for Mobile Application Pentesting and Mobile Malware Analysis
*   [Taintdroid](http://appanalysis.org) - requires AOSP compilation
*   [Android Malware Sandbox (‚≠ê290)](https://github.com/Areizen/Android-Malware-Sandbox)
*   [Runtime Mobile Security (RMS) (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/m0bilesecurity/RMS-Runtime-Mobile-Security) - is a powerful web interface that helps you to manipulate Android and iOS Apps at Runtime
*   ~~[ViaLab Community Edition](https://www.nowsecure.com/blog/2014/09/09/introducing-vialab-community-edition/)~~
*   ~~[Mercury](https://labs.mwrinfosecurity.com/tools/2012/03/16/mercury/)~~
*   ~~[Cobradroid](https://thecobraden.com/projects/cobradroid/) ‚Äì custom image for malware analysis~~

### Tools / Reverse Engineering

*   [emacs syntax coloring for smali files (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/strazzere/Emacs-Smali)
*   [vim syntax coloring for smali files](http://codetastrophe.com/smali.vim)
*   [AndBug (‚≠ê599)](https://github.com/swdunlop/AndBug)
*   [Androguard (‚≠ê5.7k)](https://github.com/androguard/androguard) ‚Äì powerful, integrates well with other tools
*   [Apktool](https://ibotpeaches.github.io/Apktool/) ‚Äì really useful for compilation/decompilation (uses smali)
*   [Android Framework for Exploitation (‚≠ê192)](https://github.com/appknox/AFE)
*   [Bypass signature and permission checks for IPCs (‚≠ê83)](https://github.com/iSECPartners/Android-KillPermAndSigChecks)
*   [Dex2Jar (‚≠ê13k)](https://github.com/pxb1988/dex2jar) - dex to jar converter
*   [Enjarify (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/google/enjarify) - dex to jar converter from Google
*   [Dedexer](https://sourceforge.net/projects/dedexer/)
*   [Fino (‚≠ê107)](https://github.com/sysdream/fino)
*   [Indroid](https://bitbucket.org/aseemjakhar/indroid) ‚Äì thread injection kit
*   [IntentSniffer](https://www.nccgroup.com/us/our-research/intent-sniffer/)
*   [Introspy (‚≠ê475)](https://github.com/iSECPartners/Introspy-Android)
*   [Jad](https://varaneckas.com/jad/) - Java decompiler
*   [JD-GUI (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/java-decompiler/jd-gui) - Java decompiler
*   [CFR](http://www.benf.org/other/cfr/) - Java decompiler
*   [Krakatau (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/Storyyeller/Krakatau) - Java decompiler
*   [FernFlower (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/fesh0r/fernflower) - Java decompiler
*   [Redexer (‚≠ê167)](https://github.com/plum-umd/redexer) ‚Äì apk manipulation
*   [Simplify Android deobfuscator (‚≠ê4.6k)](https://github.com/CalebFenton/simplify)
*   [Bytecode viewer (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/Konloch/bytecode-viewer)
*   [Radare2 (‚≠ê22k)](https://github.com/radare/radare2)
*   [Jadx (‚≠ê45k)](https://github.com/skylot/jadx)
*   [Dwarf (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/iGio90/Dwarf) - GUI for reverse engineering
*   [Andromeda (‚≠ê709)](https://github.com/secrary/Andromeda) - Another basic command-line reverse engineering tool
*   [apk-mitm (‚≠ê4.3k)](https://github.com/shroudedcode/apk-mitm) - A CLI application that prepares Android APK files for HTTPS inspection
*   [Noia (‚≠ê119)](https://github.com/0x742/noia) - Simple Android application sandbox file browser tool
*   [MVT (Mobile Verification Toolkit) (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/mvt-project/mvt) - a collection of utilities to simplify and automate the process of gathering forensic traces helpful to identify a potential compromise of Android and iOS devices
*   ~~[Procyon](https://bitbucket.org/mstrobel/procyon/wiki/Java%20Decompiler) - Java decompiler~~
*   ~~[Smali viewer](http://blog.avlyun.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/SmaliViewer.zip)~~
*   ~~[ZjDroid](https://github.com/BaiduSecurityLabs/ZjDroid)~~, ~~[fork/mirror](https://github.com/yangbean9/ZjDroid)~~
*   ~~[Dare](http://siis.cse.psu.edu/dare/index.html) ‚Äì .dex to .class converter~~

### Tools / Fuzz Testing

*   [Radamsa Fuzzer (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/anestisb/radamsa-android)
*   [Honggfuzz (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/google/honggfuzz)
*   [Media Fuzzing Framework for Android (‚≠ê334)](https://github.com/fuzzing/MFFA)
*   [AndroFuzz (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/jonmetz/AndroFuzz)

### Tools / Market Crawlers

*   [Aptoide downloader (Node) (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/dweinstein/node-aptoide) - download apps from Aptoide third-party Android market
*   [Appland downloader (Node) (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/dweinstein/node-appland) - download apps from Appland third-party Android market
*   [PlaystoreDownloader (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/ClaudiuGeorgiu/PlaystoreDownloader) - PlaystoreDownloader is a tool for downloading Android applications directly from the Google Play Store. After an initial (one-time) configuration, applications can be downloaded by specifying their package name.

### Tools / Misc Tools

*   [AXMLPrinter2](http://code.google.com/p/android4me/downloads/detail?name=AXMLPrinter2.jar) - to convert binary XML files to human-readable XML files
*   [adb autocomplete (‚≠ê255)](https://github.com/mbrubeck/android-completion)
*   [mitmproxy (‚≠ê40k)](https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy)
*   [dockerfile/androguard (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/dweinstein/dockerfile-androguard)
*   [Android Vulnerability Test Suite (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/AndroidVTS/android-vts) - android-vts scans a device for set of vulnerabilities
*   ~~[Android Device Security Database](https://www.android-device-security.org/client/datatable) - Database of security features of Android devices~~
*   ~~[Opcodes table for quick reference](http://ww38.xchg.info/corkami/opcodes_tables.pdf)~~
*   ~~[APK-Downloader](http://codekiem.com/2012/02/24/apk-downloader/)~~ - seems dead now
*   ~~[Dalvik opcodes](http://pallergabor.uw.hu/androidblog/dalvik_opcodes.html)~~

### Tools / Vulnerable Applications for practice

*   [Vuldroid (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/jaiswalakshansh/Vuldroid)
*   [ExploitMe Android Labs](http://securitycompass.github.io/AndroidLabs/setup.html)
*   [GoatDroid (‚≠ê243)](https://github.com/jackMannino/OWASP-GoatDroid-Project)
*   [Android InsecureBank (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/dineshshetty/Android-InsecureBankv2)
*   [Insecureshop (‚≠ê246)](https://github.com/optiv/insecureshop)

### Academic/Research/Publications/Books / Research Papers

*   [A good collection of static analysis papers](https://tthtlc.wordpress.com/2011/09/01/static-analysis-of-android-applications/)

### Academic/Research/Publications/Books / Others

*   [doridori/Android-Security-Reference (‚≠ê953)](https://github.com/doridori/Android-Security-Reference)
*   [android app security checklist (‚≠ê878)](https://github.com/b-mueller/android_app_security_checklist)
*   [Mobile App Pentest Cheat Sheet (‚≠ê5k)](https://github.com/tanprathan/MobileApp-Pentest-Cheatsheet)

### Exploits/Vulnerabilities/Bugs / List

*   [Android's reported security vulnerabilities](https://www.cvedetails.com/vulnerability-list/vendor_id-1224/product_id-19997/Google-Android.html)
*   [OWASP Mobile Top 10 2016](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Mobile_Top_10_2016-Top_10)
*   [Exploit Database](https://www.exploit-db.com/search/?action=search\&q=android) - click search
*   [Vulnerability Google Doc](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/pub?key=0Am5hHW4ATym7dGhFU1A4X2lqbUJtRm1QSWNRc3E0UlE\&single=true\&gid=0\&output=html)
*   [Google Android Security Team‚Äôs Classifications for Potentially Harmful Applications (Malware)](https://source.android.com/security/reports/Google_Android_Security_PHA_classifications.pdf)
*   ~~[Android Devices Security Patch Status](https://kb.androidtamer.com/Device_Security_Patch_tracker/)~~

### Exploits/Vulnerabilities/Bugs / Malware

*   [Android Malware Github repo (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/ashishb/android-malware)
*   [Contagio Mobile Malware Mini Dump](http://contagiominidump.blogspot.com)
*   [Drebin](https://www.sec.tu-bs.de/~danarp/drebin/)
*   [Android Adware and General Malware Dataset](https://www.unb.ca/cic/datasets/android-adware.html)
*   ~~[Admire](http://admire.necst.it/)~~

### Exploits/Vulnerabilities/Bugs / How to report Security issues

*   [Android Reports and Resources (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/B3nac/Android-Reports-and-Resources) - List of Android Hackerone disclosed reports and other resources
items.content_html:
Tools / Online Analyzers

  • Appknox - not free
  • Virustotal - max 128MB
  • Fraunhofer App-ray - not free
  • NowSecure Lab Automated - Enterprise tool for mobile app security testing both Android and iOS mobile apps. Lab Automated features dynamic and static analysis on real devices in the cloud to return results in minutes. Not free
  • AppSweep by Guardsquare - Free, fast Android application security testing for developers
  • BitBaan
  • AVC UnDroid
  • AppCritique - Upload your Android APKs and receive comprehensive free security assessments
  • NVISO ApkScan - sunsetting on Oct 31, 2019
  • Mobile Malware Sandbox
  • IBM Security AppScan Mobile Analyzer - not free
  • Visual Threat - no longer an Android app analyzer
  • Tracedroid
  • habo - 10/day
  • CopperDroid
  • SandDroid
  • Stowaway
  • Anubis
  • Mobile app insight
  • Mobile-Sandbox
  • Ijiami
  • Comdroid
  • Android Sandbox
  • Foresafe
  • Dexter
  • MobiSec Eacus
  • Fireeye- max 60MB 15/day

Tools / Static Analysis Tools

  • ApkAnalyser (‚≠ê1k)
  • APKInspector (‚≠ê844)
  • DroidLegacy
  • FlowDroid
  • Android Decompiler ‚Äì not free
  • Amandroid
  • SmaliSCA (‚≠ê323) - Smali Static Code Analysis
  • Madrolyzer (‚≠ê109) - extracts actionable data like C&C, phone number etc.
  • ConDroid (‚≠ê56) - Performs a combination of symbolic + concrete execution of the app
  • DroidRA (‚≠ê51)
  • Quark-Engine (‚≠ê1.5k) - An Obfuscation-Neglect Android Malware Scoring System
  • One Step Decompiler (‚≠ê277) - Android APK Decompilation for the Lazy
  • APKLeaks (‚≠ê5.4k) - Scanning APK file for URIs, endpoints & secrets.
  • Mobile Audit (‚≠ê217) - Web application for performing Static Analysis and detecting malware in Android APKs.
  • Several tools from PSU

Tools / App Vulnerability Scanners

  • AndroBugs (‚≠ê1.2k)
  • Nogotofail (‚≠ê2.9k)
  • Devknox - IDE plugin to build secure Android apps. Not maintained anymore.

Tools / Dynamic Analysis Tools

  • Androl4b (‚≠ê1.1k)- A Virtual Machine For Assessing Android applications, Reverse Engineering and Malware Analysis
  • House (‚≠ê1.4k)- House: A runtime mobile application analysis toolkit with a Web GUI, powered by Frida, written in Python.
  • Droidbox (‚≠ê782)
  • Drozer (‚≠ê4.2k)
  • Android Hooker (‚≠ê412) - Dynamic Java code instrumentation (requires the Substrate Framework)
  • ProbeDroid (‚≠ê200) - Dynamic Java code instrumentation
  • DECAF (‚≠ê822) - Dynamic Executable Code Analysis Framework based on QEMU (DroidScope is now an extension to DECAF)
  • CuckooDroid (‚≠ê590) - Android extension for Cuckoo sandbox
  • Mem (‚≠ê68) - Memory analysis of Android (root required)
  • Crowdroid ‚Äì unable to find the actual tool
  • Android Security Evaluation Framework - not under active development anymore
  • Android Linux Kernel modules (‚≠ê213)
  • StaDynA (‚≠ê23) - a system supporting security app analysis in the presence of dynamic code update features (dynamic class loading and reflection). This tool combines static and dynamic analysis of Android applications in order to reveal the hidden/updated behavior and extend static analysis results with this information.
  • DroidAnalytics (‚≠ê29) - incomplete
  • Vezir Project (‚≠ê108) - Virtual Machine for Mobile Application Pentesting and Mobile Malware Analysis
  • Taintdroid - requires AOSP compilation
  • Android Malware Sandbox (‚≠ê290)
  • Runtime Mobile Security (RMS) (‚≠ê2.8k) - is a powerful web interface that helps you to manipulate Android and iOS Apps at Runtime
  • ViaLab Community Edition
  • Mercury
  • Cobradroid ‚Äì custom image for malware analysis

Tools / Reverse Engineering

  • emacs syntax coloring for smali files (‚≠ê34)
  • vim syntax coloring for smali files
  • AndBug (‚≠ê599)
  • Androguard (‚≠ê5.7k) ‚Äì powerful, integrates well with other tools
  • Apktool ‚Äì really useful for compilation/decompilation (uses smali)
  • Android Framework for Exploitation (‚≠ê192)
  • Bypass signature and permission checks for IPCs (‚≠ê83)
  • Dex2Jar (‚≠ê13k) - dex to jar converter
  • Enjarify (‚≠ê2.7k) - dex to jar converter from Google
  • Dedexer
  • Fino (‚≠ê107)
  • Indroid ‚Äì thread injection kit
  • IntentSniffer
  • Introspy (‚≠ê475)
  • Jad - Java decompiler
  • JD-GUI (‚≠ê15k) - Java decompiler
  • CFR - Java decompiler
  • Krakatau (‚≠ê2.1k) - Java decompiler
  • FernFlower (‚≠ê3.7k) - Java decompiler
  • Redexer (‚≠ê167) ‚Äì apk manipulation
  • Simplify Android deobfuscator (‚≠ê4.6k)
  • Bytecode viewer (‚≠ê15k)
  • Radare2 (‚≠ê22k)
  • Jadx (‚≠ê45k)
  • Dwarf (‚≠ê1.3k) - GUI for reverse engineering
  • Andromeda (‚≠ê709) - Another basic command-line reverse engineering tool
  • apk-mitm (‚≠ê4.3k) - A CLI application that prepares Android APK files for HTTPS inspection
  • Noia (‚≠ê119) - Simple Android application sandbox file browser tool
  • MVT (Mobile Verification Toolkit) (‚≠ê11k) - a collection of utilities to simplify and automate the process of gathering forensic traces helpful to identify a potential compromise of Android and iOS devices
  • Procyon - Java decompiler
  • Smali viewer
  • ZjDroid, fork/mirror
  • Dare ‚Äì .dex to .class converter

Tools / Fuzz Testing

  • Radamsa Fuzzer (‚≠ê66)
  • Honggfuzz (‚≠ê3.2k)
  • Media Fuzzing Framework for Android (‚≠ê334)
  • AndroFuzz (‚≠ê38)

Tools / Market Crawlers

  • Aptoide downloader (Node) (‚≠ê25) - download apps from Aptoide third-party Android market
  • Appland downloader (Node) (‚≠ê18) - download apps from Appland third-party Android market
  • PlaystoreDownloader (‚≠ê1.2k) - PlaystoreDownloader is a tool for downloading Android applications directly from the Google Play Store. After an initial (one-time) configuration, applications can be downloaded by specifying their package name.

Tools / Misc Tools

  • AXMLPrinter2 - to convert binary XML files to human-readable XML files
  • adb autocomplete (‚≠ê255)
  • mitmproxy (‚≠ê40k)
  • dockerfile/androguard (‚≠ê42)
  • Android Vulnerability Test Suite (‚≠ê1k) - android-vts scans a device for set of vulnerabilities
  • Android Device Security Database - Database of security features of Android devices
  • Opcodes table for quick reference
  • APK-Downloader - seems dead now
  • Dalvik opcodes

Tools / Vulnerable Applications for practice

  • Vuldroid (‚≠ê64)
  • ExploitMe Android Labs
  • GoatDroid (‚≠ê243)
  • Android InsecureBank (‚≠ê1.3k)
  • Insecureshop (‚≠ê246)

Academic/Research/Publications/Books / Research Papers

  • A good collection of static analysis papers

Academic/Research/Publications/Books / Others

  • doridori/Android-Security-Reference (‚≠ê953)
  • android app security checklist (‚≠ê878)
  • Mobile App Pentest Cheat Sheet (‚≠ê5k)

Exploits/Vulnerabilities/Bugs / List

  • Android's reported security vulnerabilities
  • OWASP Mobile Top 10 2016
  • Exploit Database - click search
  • Vulnerability Google Doc
  • Google Android Security Team‚Äôs Classifications for Potentially Harmful Applications (Malware)
  • Android Devices Security Patch Status

Exploits/Vulnerabilities/Bugs / Malware

  • Android Malware Github repo (‚≠ê1.1k)
  • Contagio Mobile Malware Mini Dump
  • Drebin
  • Android Adware and General Malware Dataset
  • Admire

Exploits/Vulnerabilities/Bugs / How to report Security issues

  • Android Reports and Resources (‚≠ê1.6k) - List of Android Hackerone disclosed reports and other resources

items.title: Awesome Vite
items.content_text:
### Framework-agnostic Plugins / Integrations

*   [unplugin-config (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/kirklin/unplugin-config) - Configuration file generator for web apps, allowing external customization of global variables without repackaging.
items.content_html:
Framework-agnostic Plugins / Integrations

  • unplugin-config (‚≠ê27) - Configuration file generator for web apps, allowing external customization of global variables without repackaging.
